classic propaganda as one usually thinks

sense that it is made by a leader
a technician a
political or religious head who acts
from the superior position of his
authority and seeks to influence the
crowd below
such propaganda comes from above
it is conceived in the secret recesses
of political enclaves
it uses all
technological technical methods of
centralized mass communication it
envelops a mass of individuals but those

above made by laswell between direct

propaganda

the propagandy remains alone even though

or hatred though parts of the shouts of
the crowd do not put him in

believes it is
